trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with ArcGIS | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with ArcGIS | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use ArcGIS with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use ArcGIS with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ArcGIS.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ArcGIS.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: An ArcGIS single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: An ArcGIS single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ArcGIS will be able to single sign into the application at your ArcGIS company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ArcGIS will be able to single sign into the application at your ArcGIS company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for ArcGIS
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for ArcGIS

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ArcGIS.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ArcGIS.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type ArcGIS.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type ArcGIS.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applcation Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applcation Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select ArcGIS, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select ArcGIS, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ArcGIS</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ArcGIS</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ArcGIS with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ArcGIS with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the ArcGIS application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the ArcGIS application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to ArcGIS page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to ArcGIS page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the ArcGIS Sign In URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign in using the following pattern "https://company.maps.arcgis.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the ArcGIS Sign In URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign in using the following pattern "https://company.maps.arcgis.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at ArcGIS page, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at ArcGIS page, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your ArcGIS company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your ArcGIS company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click Edit Settings.
trans-unit.target: Click Edit Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Edit Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Edit Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Security.
trans-unit.target: Click Security.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Security</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Security</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Under Enterprise Logins, click Set Identity Provider.
trans-unit.target: Under Enterprise Logins, click Set Identity Provider.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enterprise Logins</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enterprise Logins</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Set Identity Provider configuration page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Set Identity Provider configuration page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set Identity Provider</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set Identity Provider</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Name textbox, type your organization’s name.
trans-unit.target: In the Name textbox, type your organization’s name.

trans-unit.source: For Metadata for the Enterprise Identity Provider will be supplied using, select A File.
trans-unit.target: For Metadata for the Enterprise Identity Provider will be supplied using, select A File.

trans-unit.source: To upload your downloaded metadata file, click Choose file.
trans-unit.target: To upload your downloaded metadata file, click Choose file.

trans-unit.source: Click Set Identity Provider.
trans-unit.target: Click Set Identity Provider.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into ArcGIS, they must be provisioned into ArcGIS.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into ArcGIS, they must be provisioned into ArcGIS.

trans-unit.source: In the case of ArcGIS, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of ArcGIS, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your ArcGIS tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your ArcGIS tenant.

trans-unit.source: Click Invite Members.
trans-unit.target: Click Invite Members.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Invite Members</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Invite Members</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Add members automatically without sending an email, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Select Add members automatically without sending an email, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Members Automatically</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Members Automatically</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Members dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Members dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add and review</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add and review</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter the First Name, Last Name and Email of a valid AAD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: Enter the First Name, Last Name and Email of a valid AAD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Add And Review.
trans-unit.target: Click Add And Review.

trans-unit.source: Review the data you have entered, and then click Add Members.
trans-unit.target: Review the data you have entered, and then click Add Members.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add member</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add member</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can use any other ArcGIS user account creation tools or APIs provided by ArcGIS to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other ArcGIS user account creation tools or APIs provided by ArcGIS to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the ArcGIS **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the ArcGIS **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
